title: Tools for Unmxing Spectral Flow Cytometry Data
text: basic example workflow, using samples ID7000. illustrates weighted least squares unmixing. per-cell autofluorescence extraction per-cell fluorophore optimization, see articles topics. Please see Full Workflow
code: library( AutoSpectral )  # Define the location of the single-stained control files. control.dir <- "./Cell controls"  # Get the parameters for your cytometer. # Supported cytometers include "aurora", "id7000", "a8", "s8" and "opteon". asp <- get.autospectral.param( cytometer = "id7000", figures = TRUE )  # Optionally, create a control file (see article on this). # After creating it, manually edit to ensure it is correct. create.control.file( control.dir, asp )  # Locate the edited control file. control.def.file <- "fcs_control_file.csv"  # check the control file for errors control.file.errors <- check.control.file( control.dir, control.def.file, asp )  ## Adjustments to automated gating # This will be covered more extensively elsewhere. # in this case, the cells on scatter are very small, so we modify the target. asp$gate.bound.density.max.target.cells <- 0  # Load the control files, gate, prepare for spectral extraction. # This is usually the slowest step. flow.control <- define.flow.control( control.dir, control.def.file, asp )  # For speed and accuracy, the recommended approach is to clean the controls # using separate (universal) negative samples for both beads and cells. # In doing so, we select cells with matching autofluorescent background and # restrict the calculations to the brightest events. flow.control <- clean.controls( flow.control, asp )  # Extract the clean spectra univ.neg.spectra <- get.fluorophore.spectra( flow.control, asp,                                                use.clean.expr = TRUE,                               title = "Universal Negative Cells" )  # By default AutoSpectral extracts autofluorescence as a spectrum. # This is comparable to "Autofluorescence as a Fluorescent Tag" in SpectroFlo # More on this later. # To remove this AF parameter for unmixing: no.af.spectra <- univ.neg.spectra[ ! rownames( univ.neg.spectra ) == "AF", ]  ## Unmixing # Set the location of the raw files to be unmixed. sample.dir <- "./Raw samples"  # Perform unmixing, here we will unmix all fcs files in the folder using  # Weighted least squares (WLS or in Sony lingo, WLSM). unmix.folder( sample.dir, no.af.spectra, asp, flow.control, method = "WLS" )

title: Tools for Unmxing Spectral Flow Cytometry Data
text: Installation via GitHub take minute . takes less Dell i7 core laptop. Occasionally, help gets corrupted. Just re-install happens. know happens, let know. Installation AutoSpectralRcpp take couple minutes code needs compile. also first install Rtools compiler, take longer, probably 10 minutes . Upgrading BLAS LAPACK (see ) also takes several minutes ’re taking time read instructions carefully. Runtime vary considerably depending size quantity files ’re processing. benchmark 42-colour Aurora data set using single-stained cell controls plenty data, slow steps pre-processing pipeline define.flow.control() clean.controls(). Aurora dataset aforementioned i7 Windows laptop, get: * define.flow.control() v0.8.7: 12min sequential, 9min parallel * define.flow.control() v0.9.0: 4min sequential, 2min parallel * clean.controls() v0.8.7: 11min sequential, possible parallel * clean.controls() v0.9.0: 11min sequential, 6.5min parallel, fully optimized * get.spectral.variants() v.0.8.7: 2min sequential, 1min parallel * get.spectral.variants() v.0.9.0: 65sec sequential, 32sec parallel Unmixing time depends following variable: file size (number cells/events, including debris) number detectors number fluorophores unmixing algorithm. OLS WLS fast, per-cell AF extraction ~50x slower, per-cell fluorophore optimization 2-4x slower per-cell AF running “fast” approximation using AutoSpectralRcpp, 20-50x slower using “slow” exact calculation, using AutoSpectralRcpp. Using “fast” approximation pure R likely comparable slower “slow” method C++. text: Version 0.8.1: fluorophores, rearranging detectors needed Version 0.8.2: Support Mosaic Xenith cytometers Version 0.8.3: Patch error introduced 0.8.2 Version 0.8.4: Changes error messaging check.control.file Version 0.8.5: Improvements keyword handling writing FCS files Version 0.8.6: Improvements plotting, fluorophore matching Version 0.8.7: Support Symphony A5 SE Cytek Northern Lights. improvements plotting. Changes solve unmix.ols unmix.wls suggested SamGG. New functions save.unmixing.matrix calculate.weights Patches define.flow.control causing redundant gates created. Code legibility formatting.

title: Clean Controls — clean.controls
text: four-part function clean single-color controls order extract fluorophore signatures. part can run independently: Stage 1: PeacoQC eliminate flow artefacts. required cases. Stage 2: Trimming eliminate extreme events. recommended use cases. Stage 3: Autofluorescence noise removal using PCA unmixing matching unstained (cells ). Stage 4: Brightest event selection positive, universal negative matching negative, downsampling speed RLM spectra optimization.

title: Clean Controls — clean.controls
code: clean.controls(   flow.control,   asp,   time.clean = FALSE,   trim = FALSE,   trim.factor = NULL,   af.remove = TRUE,   universal.negative = TRUE,   downsample = TRUE,   negative.n = asp$negative.n,   positive.n = asp$positive.n,   scatter.match = TRUE,   scrub = FALSE,   intermediate.figures = FALSE,   main.figures = TRUE,   parallel = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   threads = NULL )

title: Clean Controls — clean.controls
text: flow.control list prepared using define.flow.control, containing data essential information cytometer data structure. asp AutoSpectral parameter list, prepared using get.autospectral.param. time.clean Logical, default FALSE. Whether run PeacoQC remove time-based inconsistencies controls. trim Logical, default FALSE. Whether remove extreme events (positive negative) controls. trim.factor Numeric. Default asp$rlm.trim.factor. Required trim = TRUE. af.remove Logical, default TRUE. Whether remove intrusive autofluorescence contamination cell controls using PCA-based identification gating. Requires universal negatives defined control file flow.control. universal.negative Logical, default TRUE. Whether use universal negative sample negative spectral extraction. Requires universal negatives defined control file flow.control. downsample Logical, default TRUE. Whether reduce cell bead control events speed processing. negative.n Integer. Number events include downsampled negative population. Default asp$negative.n. positive.n Integer. Number events include downsampled positive population. Default asp$positive.n. scatter.match Logical, default TRUE. Whether select negative events based scatter profiles matching positive events. Defines region FSC SSC based distribution selected positive events. scrub Logical, TRUE allows re-cleaning already cleaned data, provided clean data flow.control. intermediate.figures Logical, TRUE returns additional figures show inner workings cleaning, including definition low-AF cell gates PCA-unmixed unstained spectral ribbon plots AF exclusion unstained. Default FALSE speed processing. main.figures Logical, TRUE creates main figures show impact intrusive autofluorescent event removal scatter-matching negatives. parallel Logical, default FALSE, case parallel processing used. Parallel processing likely faster many small files read . data larger, parallel processing may accelerate process much. verbose Logical, default TRUE. Set FALSE suppress messages. threads Numeric, number threads use parallel processing. Default NULL revert asp$worker.process.n parallel=TRUE.

title: Define Flow Control — define.flow.control
text: complex function designed convert single-stained control FCS files metadata control.def.file data structure AutoSpectral. reads metadata file, locates corresponding FCS files, determines gates needed based variables beads cells, large.gate, viability.gate, creates gates combination. imports gates data FCS files assigns various factors track data. Parallel processing parallel=TRUE likely speed run considerably Mac Linux systems supporting forking, likely help much Windows unless >10 cores available.

title: Define Flow Control — define.flow.control
text: control.dir File path single-stained control FCS files. control.def.file CSV file defining single-color control file names, fluorophores represent, marker names, peak channels, gating requirements. asp AutoSpectral parameter list defined using get.autospectral.param. gate Logical, default TRUE, case, automated gating performed. FALSE, FCS files imported without automatically generated gates applied. , data files used. intended allow user pre-gate files commercial software. parallel Logical, default FALSE, case parallel processing used. Parallel processing likely faster many small files read . data larger, parallel processing may accelerate process much. verbose Logical, default TRUE. Set FALSE suppress messages. threads Numeric, number threads use parallel processing. Default NULL revert asp$worker.process.n parallel=TRUE.

title: Define Flow Control — define.flow.control

Links events samples. event.type: Type events. expr.data: Expression data used extracting spectra.

title: Save Unmixing Matrix — save.unmixing.matrix
text: function calculates saves unmixing matrix CSV file. default, produce ordinary least-squares (OLS) matrix. save weighted least-squares (WLS) unmixing matrix, supply detector weights argument weights. Weights numeric vector length detectors spectra. Good options use 1) detector noise (reliability) measurements, instance, CVs instrument QC 2) empirical data FCS file. latter, take raw data spectral detector channels apply function colMeans. provides average signal level detecors, can assume proportional noise level. cases, weights inverse (1/noise). Use function calculate.weights() extract colMeans weighting FCS file.

text: fcs.file character string specifying path FCS file. spectra matrix containing spectral data. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. Prepare using get.autospectral.param flow.control list containing flow cytometry control parameters. method character string specifying unmixing method use. default Automatic, uses AutoSpectral AF extraction af.spectra provided automatically selects OLS WLS depending normal given cytometer asp$cytometer. means files ID7000, A8 S8 unmixed using WLS others unmixed OLS. option can set manually. Manual options OLS, WLS, AutoSpectral, Poisson FastPoisson. Default OLS. FastPoisson requires installation AutoSpectralRcpp. weighted Logical, whether use ordinary weighted least squares unmixing base algorithm AutoSpectral unmixing. Default FALSE use OLS. weights Optional numeric vector weights (one per fluorescent detector). Default NULL, case weighting done channel means (Poisson variance). used WLS. af.spectra Spectral signatures autofluorescences, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns. Prepare using get.af.spectra. Required AutoSpectral unmixing. Default NULL thus provoke failure spectra provided AutoSpectral selected. spectra.variants Named list (names fluorophores) carrying matrices spectral signature variations fluorophore. Prepare using get.spectral.variants. Default NULL. Used AutoSpectral unmixing. Required per-cell fluorophore optimization. output.dir character string specifying directory save unmixed FCS file. Default NULL. file.suffix character string append output file name. Default NULL. include.raw logical value indicating whether include raw expression data written FCS file. Default FALSE. include.imaging logical value indicating whether include imaging parameters written FCS file. Default FALSE. calculate.error Logical, whether calculate RMSE unmixing model accuracy include keyword FCS file. use.dist0 Logical, controls whether selection optimal AF signature cell determined unmixing brings fluorophore signals closest 0 (use.dist0 = TRUE) unmixing minimizes per-cell residual (use.dist0 = FALSE). Default TRUE. Used AutoSpectral unmixing. divergence.threshold Numeric. Used FastPoisson . Threshold trigger reversion towards WLS unmixing Poisson result diverges given point. divergence.handling String. handle divergent cells Poisson IRLS. Options NonNeg (non-negativity enforced), WLS (revert WLS intial unmix) Balance (WLS NonNeg averaged). Default Balance balance.weight Numeric. Weighting average non-convergent cells. Used Balance option divergence.handling. Default 0.5. speed Selector precision-speed trade-AutoSpectral per-cell fluorophore optimization. Options default fast, selects best spectral fit per cell updating predicted values fluorophore independently without repeating unnmixing, medium uses Woodbury-Sherman-Morrison rank-one updating unnmixing matrix better results moderate slow-, slow, explicitly recomputes unmixing matrix variant maximum precision. fast method one available AutoSpectral package slow pure R implementation. Installation AutoSpectralRcpp strongly encouraged. parallel Logical, default TRUE, enables parallel processing per-cell unmixing methods. threads Numeric, default NULL, case asp$worker.process.n used. asp$worker.process.n set default one less available cores machine. Multi-threading used parallel TRUE.

title: AutoSpectral 0.9.0 (2025-12-07)
text: Unmixing matrix can saved via save.unmixing.matrix() Weights can calculated via calculate.weights() Plotting unmixing matrix get.fluorophore.spectra

title: AutoSpectral 0.9.0 (2025-12-07)
text: stable, faster parallel backend Changes get.spectral.variants, including permanent fixing previously user-modifiable parameters low-level denoising spectra. checks check.control.file. Faster AutoSpectral unmixing base R. Adjustments reduce discontinuities produced unmixing. See also updates AutoSpectralRcpp, including large speed general improvement Poisson IRLS unmixing. Changes solve unmix.ols unmix.wls suggested SamGG. FCS files now written “-” channel names, e.g., “PE-” rather just “PE”.

title: AutoSpectral 0.9.0 (2025-12-07)
text: Bug patch situations beads using internal negatives get.fluor.variants Patch reload.flow.control bug affecting ID7000 samples.

title: AutoSpectral 0.8.7 (2025-12-01)
text: Support Symphony A5 SE Support Cytek Northern Lights Shiny app control file setup via AutoSpectralHelper Marker names now added control file based matches FCS file names, possible. Hotspot(TM) matrix calculated plotted per pre-print Peter Mage et al.
